column4: I've been trying to install cnet (a network simulator), but every time I try to run make, I get the same error: warning: cast from pointer to integer of different size. What should I look for in changing the default int size to match the one on my 64-bit machine?
it's not an error if it's a warning
you should... consider.. installing amd64 ubuntu if you have a 64bit machine
$ uname -a
that's amd64. hence x86_64
go to system > preferences > display/graphics and see what driver you're using
system menu > administration > screens & graphics > graphics card tab, what is listed under driver
click the menu and try to change it to nvidia, is nvidia listed?
Should I use the "Choose driver by model" radio button?
under "choose driver by name"
Or, in the choose driver by name>
yes that's the one
ok, is it still selected under "driver" now?
let me rephrase, does "driver" in the screens & graphics admin pane say "nvidia" now?
After I clicked okay and closed the thing out, I reopened it and it went back to vesa.
Before I close it, it says it right now.
I just clicked "test" and it closed the window down. :(
try system menu > administration > restricted drivers manager
is there anything listed in the restricted drivers manager?
The only one is Atheros HAL. It is enabled and in use.
weird, nvidia should be listed.. i don't really know at this point, try googling for ubuntu nvidia driver
or maybe someone else can help you
Okay. Thanks for all your help. :)
no problem :)
